prompt: Which buses does each AC power system consists of?
answer_md:
- Transfer bus (1)
- Main bus (1)
- Galley buses (2)
- Ground Service Bus (1).

prompt: What does selecting GRD PWR Switch ON do on the ground with both generators off the bus?
answer_md: If ground power available:\n- Removes previously connected power from AC transfer buses\n- Connects ground power to AC transfer buses if power quality is correct

prompt: What does selecting either APU GEN switch to ON do to the AC transfer buses?
answer_md:
If neither AC transfer bus powered by IDG:
- Connects both AC transfer buses to APU generator
- Disconnected external power
- Illuminates opposite SOURCE OFF light until other APU GEN switch moved to ON.
If both AC transfer buses powered by IDGs: 
- Powers the related transfer bus from the APU generator
- Other transfer bus continues to receive power from the IDG

prompt: What is the order of load shedding during single generator operation?
answer_md:
Sheds incrementally:
1. Galleys and main bus on transfer bus 2
2. Galleys and main bus on transfer bus 1
3. IFE buses.

prompt: What are the three main divisions of the B737 electrical power system?
answer_md: - AC power system\n- DC power system\n- Standby power system.

prompt: Under which two conditions does the cross bus tie relay open?
answer_md: - At glideslope capture during a flight director or autopilot ILS approach\n- When the BUS TRANSFER switch is positioned to OFF.

prompt: Under normal conditions, how are DC bus 1, DC bus 2, and the DC standby buses powered? How are they connected to one another?
answer_md: - TR1 and TR2 each power DC bus 1, DC bus 2, and the DC standby bus.\n- They are connected via the cross bus tie relay

prompt: What is the chemistry and nominal voltage of the battery? Where is it located?
answer_md: - 24V nickel-cadmium battery\n- Located in the electronics compartment

prompt: After loss of both generators, which DC buses does the battery power?
answer_md:
- Battery bus
- DC standby bus
- Hot battery bus
- Switched hot battery bus.

prompt: What are the components (2) and buses (5) that comprise the Standby Power System
answer_md:
- Static inverter
- Main battery.
- AC standby bus
- DC standby bus
- Battery bus
- Hot battery bus
- Switched hot battery bus.

prompt: With both AC Transfer Buses powered by their generators and the guards down on the BAT and STANDBY POWER switches, what powers the following buses: AC Standby Bus; DC Standby Bus; Battery Bus; Hot Battery Bus; Switched Hot Battery Bus?
answer_md:
In the Normal Standby Power System Configuration, what powers the following buses?  AC Standby Bus: AC Transfer Bus #1
• DC Standby Bus: TR1, TR2, and TR3
• Battery Bus: TR3
• Hot Battery Bus: Battery and/or Battery Charger
• Switched Hot Battery Bus: Battery and/or Battery Charger.

prompt: With the loss of all AC generators and the guards down on the BATTERY  and STANDBY POWER switches, what powers the following buses: AC Standby Bus; DC Standby Bus; Battery Bus; Hot Battery Bus; Switched Hot Battery Bus?
answer_md:
• With the loss of all AC generators and the guards down on the BATTERY  and STANDBY POWER switches, what powers the following buses: AC Standby Bus: Battery via static inverter
• DC Standby Bus: battery
• Battery Bus: battery
• Hot Battery Bus: battery
• Switched Hot Battery Bus: battery?
